description.raw:
Based on a user option, --output-label, the bed file will output either the superlabel only (default), the sublabel only, or both concatenated with a period. The tests produce the same result for me with and without these changes.

Update 2014-06-20
This is only done with the viterbi task for now, posterior will output superlabels only, and raise error if trying to do posterior and also trying to print sublabels. touchstone files are updated as a result of output_seg argument being passed, and viterbi regex filter which catches subseg and seg lines. Tests working now.
